task_summary: PR2 detects the fridge, approaches and aligns to the door/handle, opens the hinged fridge door, verifies it is open, then retreats.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 robot operates in a cluttered lab kitchen corner to open a small refrigerator. The sequence begins with perception of the fridge and a short approach to the door region. The end-effector yaw is set to align with the vertical door edge/handle. The robot refines alignment, actuates an open on the hinged door, confirms the door is open, and finally backs away to a safe standoff. The environment includes drawers and nearby obstacles, so motions should be deliberate with modest timeouts.
preconditions: Manipulation space free of large obstacles
Robot arm available with nominal control
stepwise_plan: Move to a front approach pose near the door.
Redetect/locate the handle or door edge.
Set wrist yaw to align with the vertical handle/edge.
Approach and align precisely to the handle region.
Command open on the hinged fridge door.
Verify the door state is open.
Retreat to a safe distance and pause.
success_criteria: Fridge door angle clearly increases and stays open
End effector at safe retreat pose
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected: re-detect or scan pattern and retry
Door jammed: increase approach alignment, then reattempt open
Unexpected contact: abort open and retreat slightly before retry
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful open verification and completed retreat/wait.

frame_3.now_evidence: End effector aligned at door edge with impending actuation.
frame_3.predicts_next: Door opening expected immediately after alignment.

node_specs.description: Detect the fridge body to initialize pose.
Approach the front of the fridge.
Redetect handle/door edge for precise alignment.
Rotate wrist to align with vertical handle/edge.
Close in and align to the pulling point.
Back away to a safe distance.

failure_modes: Door interference with nearby drawers or robot base
recovery_strategy: Re-run DetectObject with alternative viewpoint (MoveTo small offsets)
Re-align with smaller tolerance then retry OpenContainer
Abort and Retreat slightly, then repeat detect-align-open
assumptions: Door is a standard hinged door; frames show left-hinged fridge opening toward the robot.
Opening achieved via edge/handle interaction; explicit gripper close not required in this episode.

expected_success_criteria: Door visibly open in subsequent frames
Robot ends at retreat pose without collision
